top_recommendations: Review article usage in English (a, an, the).
Focus on maintaining consistent verb tenses in sentences.

practical_recommendations.title: Wrong Word
practical_recommendations.guidance: Pick the most precise word and avoid awkward or redundant phrasing.
practical_recommendations.why: 9 cases (33% of all grammar issues). This lowers precision and can sound unnatural.

practical_recommendations.title: Prepositions
practical_recommendations.guidance: Choose the correct preposition for common phrases and verbs.
practical_recommendations.why: 5 cases (19% of all grammar issues). This changes meaning in key phrases and verb patterns.

examples.error: do you have any strategy on this project
examples.correction: do you have any strategy for this project

practical_recommendations.title: Verb Form
practical_recommendations.guidance: Use the correct verb form and ensure subject-verb agreement and modal usage.
practical_recommendations.why: 5 cases (19% of all grammar issues). This makes grammar sound inconsistent and less natural.

top3_insights.title: Verb Form
top3_insights.why: 5 cases (19% of all grammar issues). This makes grammar sound inconsistent and less natural.
top3_insights.focus: Use the correct verb form and ensure subject-verb agreement and modal usage.

top_recommendations: Work on using articles correctly in sentences.
Ensure subject and verb agree in number and person.
Practice proper word order in questions and statements.

practical_recommendations.title: Wrong Word
practical_recommendations.guidance: Pick the most precise word and avoid awkward or redundant phrasing.
practical_recommendations.why: 12 cases (39% of all grammar issues). This lowers precision and can sound unnatural.

practical_recommendations.title: Articles
practical_recommendations.guidance: Use a/an/the (or zero article) correctly before nouns.
practical_recommendations.why: 6 cases (19% of all grammar issues). This reduces grammatical accuracy in noun phrases.

examples.error: as individual service for some participants of club
examples.correction: as an individual service for some participants of the club

examples.error: 50 people with lifetime value more than
examples.correction: 50 people with a lifetime value of more than

practical_recommendations.title: Prepositions
practical_recommendations.guidance: Choose the correct preposition for common phrases and verbs.
practical_recommendations.why: 5 cases (16% of all grammar issues). This changes meaning in key phrases and verb patterns.

transcript:
Speaker A: So I started recording I'm Roman. And I would like to hear your experience with your group of designers who are going to improve their English in your group.

Speaker B: Okay. I'm Andre. Every time when you say I'm Roman, it's a bit strange. You're not Roman, you're not Romanian, you're Roman. Okay. Yesterday was a pilot meeting of my English speaking clubs. And. It was six people including me and Kate. They were from design industry or almost design industry. So one girl from UX writing and three designers, different levels like seniors to design head. I started meeting at 9pm so they were working the whole day and then we were speaking. And I think that's the reason why it was not too fast as I wanted, but it was good enough for the pilot meeting. We were talking about dark patterns and ethics in design. I sent the topic before the meeting. So I sent it in the morning and they had enough time to prepare for. Was hard a bit to facilitate this meeting because sometimes I. Didn't understand some words or some sense from them. And it was hard to play ping pong with words. Just when I was trying to facilitate this meeting. I wanted to ask questions for their replies. For example, I answered the question, they reply and I answer again to build the dialogue. And it was hard a bit. But the good things I can say that I tried to. To involve people for the conversation to the conversation. I just. Sometimes when I saw someone is silent or too quiet. I tried to answer the questions or just picked someone to answer for my question. And it was a good thing I did. The whole meeting was about one hour, a bit less maybe. Also I get some feedback from people. I asked the. Honest, honest feedback and some participants gave me positive feedback, some negative things.

Speaker A: And now I don't know.

Speaker B: I just need to aggregate the whole the feedback from all of participants and analyze it with complexity and give it the full. Give it full context and try to improve something. Maybe I will try to. Acquire some people from my channel for the next meetings. We'll see. So I think it was good enough for the pilot.

Speaker A: Okay, interesting. And how did you feel? Is it. Good amount of people for one hour? Or it was too much or. Or it's six. Six people.

Speaker B: I think that's my hypothesis. So I think it will be better to think shorter for minutes and I think for 40 minutes it will be bad.

Speaker A: Could you please stop? I'm frozen. So yeah.

Speaker B: Some legs.

Speaker A: Could you please stop? I'm frozen. I hear nothing from your last paragraph from beginning. I mean I. I didn't Hear any part of your answer for my question. Could you please repeat?

Speaker B: I will. I will repeat for you.

Speaker A: And one more interruption please. Could you please speak straightforward to your microphone and please do not take like this one.

Speaker B: Okay, okay.

Speaker A: Okay.

Speaker B: I just try to find some words on my wall.

Speaker A: Yeah, I understand.

Speaker B: Yes. So my. I have a hypothesis that it will be better to decrease minutes for the meeting, for example 40 minutes. And I think I have to invite four people for 40 minutes because of me. In this way meeting will be more dynamic. Dynamical, I don't know. So yeah, I will try to. To do this to do it. And also I want to include a presentation for the meeting or Figma board or Miraboard just because it's more interesting to interact during the meeting.

Speaker A: Okay. And what do you have any strategy on this project or. Or what is the hypothesis for it?

Speaker B: Overall? I think I have a hypothesis for the whole project that I can acquire 50 people during six months. If I can do this, I can scale up the whole project because if I acquire 50 people, it's enough people. It's enough people on the market for the growing up to grow up. This, this project just. I can use the same way to acquire people as first 50 users. And then I can transform the offer from just speaking clubs to preparing for interviews. Also I can add mock interviews as individual service for some participants of club. And. We can. We can try. Bruce, are you here? Yep.

Speaker A: I'm freezing. Let me check.

Speaker B: Let me speak from my heart. What the.

Speaker A: Okay, I think it's okay. Let's go further.

Speaker B: Where I stopped.

Speaker A: That you are going to acquire 15 or 50, I'm not sure.

Speaker B: 15, 50, 50 users during six months. Then we can include mock interviews from for with the recruiter and with design lead. And then we can scale. We can take another segments for it. For example, we can include or acquire product managers, developers and others potential segments. And the best way is to just sell in the future this for one of English schools maybe.

Speaker A: Are you here? You said Your goal is 50 people. Does it mean 50 people who are paying your monthly or how it should work?

Speaker B: Yeah, the model is subscription, the main idea subscription. And I think 50 people with lifetime value more than two months, two, three months.

Speaker A: So am I right that you are going to have 50,000 rubles per month without your brother?

Speaker B: Yep.

Speaker A: So it's. It's a pity that I don't have brother at all.

Speaker B: Okay.

Speaker A: So. And do you plan to use some instruments for tracking your progress? For instance, like we have with you or maybe some. Or meetings after Session or something like else. So sorry, is it Kate backward on you or it's ridiculous cat.

Speaker B: Where is.

Speaker A: There is no one under of pillow or what? Yes. Idiot. Crazy idiot.

Speaker B: Idiot. Crazy idiot. I'm not sure about instruments right now because I think I just want to start acquire people and I think it would be better to get some feedback from them. For example, just call after two weeks with users and try to understand why they became why they came to the club and what they did expect. And is it enough now or they need something else? Maybe. I think I will use granola just to summarize the the whole meeting and give some interesting thoughts to participants after it. After the meeting. And I think that's enough for the start.

Speaker A: I have a hypothesis why people join to you because they would like to option to say find me in the club. So can you share feedback from your students to me? What was a positive moment? Mainly.

Speaker B: The main positive moment is the ability to speak English because for people it's really interesting to have a live practice and live speaking with other designers. The negative. I think the most negative thing is the hardness level.

Speaker A: What level?

Speaker B: Level of hard. Hard of. It was just hard topic for them because sometimes by the way, in Russian. In Russian it's not too easy to discuss on this topic about dark patterns, about empathy in English, it's more harder for them. Also for Dania, It were some negative moments. Additional negative moments. For example, it was meeting without presentation. It was our topic. It was not like ping pong format. And it was maybe late for him, but he compared our meeting with his English lessons. It was not lesson on my meeting, so I think the comparison.

Speaker A: Is not.

Speaker B: Relevant. Yeah, and also positive things that I'm a good facilitator. I heard this from Kate and from Max, the other designer and he really likes the format because he already visited some English clubs in last year in Krasnodar and he really likes this format. And also he really likes to speak with other designers.

Speaker A: Okay, I'm not sure that format is a good word. I'm not sure that it exists in English in this way.

Speaker B: But maybe I suppose both. Yes, it's okay. Okay.

Speaker A: And one question regarding AI. What do you think about timing that we need to have AI assistant.

Speaker B: That.

Speaker A: Will be fully comparable with us? I mean, currently you even don't see difference between AI photo and usual photo. And sometimes we have AI models and we hear no difference between human voice and model voice. So how you evaluate the timing when such kind of models will be in place so they can join to your meeting and speak with you like a human.

Speaker B: I think maybe two years or less maybe. But I think this type of meeting more about is more about.

Speaker A: Experience.

Speaker B: And about sharing experience between designers. Because if you want to connect AI and AI will discuss it will be to generic. There will be no real experience from AI. It will be generic. Thoughts And I see I. I think that live and community formats will be. Interesting for people in AI era so I bet on community products. Now.

Speaker A: Your friend jmek disturbed me so I'm not sure that I catch the main thought from your speech.

Speaker B: So as I understand I think AI can give you a real experience. So the conversation will be a little bit generic. It will sound. It will sound like real conversation but the topic will be generic and there will be no real experience from AI model. You can share. You can. Yeah, that's it.

Speaker A: Okay. Am I right that you. You mean that AI can't provide you humans experience in specific themes where you are expert? For instance regarding me, if I'm writing with AI for instance any themes regarding health I feel that AI has very deep learning and it would be interesting for me having it in speaking as well. But where I'm an expert in for instance in some details regarding financial models I feel the same as you.

Speaker B: That's why I focused on designers because that's a bit specific industry with. With different opinions. So there are some UX laws, UX patterns and it's common in the whole industry. But my experience or someone else experience is different and if you're talking with the other designer you can discuss same cases and share your experience with others and AI can do this because there is no way I experience that's not the person.

Speaker A: So I and Gen GPT wrote your negative feedback about AI so we will. We will provide it to Vasilis kroko and so P9 CBR. Okay, we have six minutes left. Do you have any theme for discussion?

Speaker B: Short?

Speaker A: Some short maybe.

Speaker B: Yeah. You can. You can try to answer the question just because I want to hear. I don't want to only speak. I want to hear too Try to answer the question. Where is the line between good marketing and. Dark pattern? Well.

Speaker A: For me it depends on feedback from users. If you consolidate it, for instance your pattern may be dark but if your user is happy. So for me it's not a problem. But if you're. What is the metric? Not CC NPS is it. It's a talk in this sphere.

Speaker B: Net Promoter Score Recommendation index like this. Yeah, it's okay. I think maybe customer satisfaction Index. That's another one.

Speaker A: Yes, customer satisfaction is okay. So for me is your. For instance, if your decrease in expenditure on marketing, for instance 10% and your decrease in customer loyalty or how to say so only 1%. For me it's okay to use such kind of marketing even if it contains some dark patterns. But if you decrease expenditure marketing and your NPS decrease as well. So it's not a good way for me because your retention will be shorter than it can be. I'm not sure that I have an answer that it's a red line, strict red line. It's always pros and cons of this decision. So. And it's. It's evident for me and for my company and for my budget that runs much better.

Speaker B: So.

Speaker A: Maybe I can use some dark patterns or if I correctly understand your question.

Speaker B: It'S okay. Okay. I think. Do we have time or we have three minutes left. Okay.

Speaker A: I have a question if you don't mind.

Speaker B: Okay.

Speaker A: So I'm going to finalize the recommendation from AI regarding our mistakes and it can be interesting to compare it with with our self check. So what do you think the most common mistakes for you and yeah, it's articles.

Speaker B: I think articles. Okay.

Speaker A: What else?

Speaker B: I think grammar when you use words. For example, he has or he have. I don't know how to say it in English. Okay. And times.

Speaker A: Okay. So me too. And I would add some wrong constructions in sentences. Also I feel that sometimes my questions are wrong in terms of grammar. And. So I. I hope this is the most common and it would be quite easy to. To trace it and correct. But articles are ridiculous I would say.

Speaker B: So the mistakes like this annoying, annoying.

Speaker A: Annoying and complicated thing for me for.

Speaker B: Instance, maybe same Apple.

Speaker A: Same. Okay, 30 minutes left. I'm stopping our recording today. I have two one for simplifying our process.

annotation_items.text: I would like to hear your experience with your group of designers who are going to improve their English in your group.
annotation_items.correction: I would like to hear about your experience with your group of designers who are going to improve their English.
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'in your group' is repetitive and should be removed for clarity.

annotation_items.text: pilot meeting of my English speaking clubs.
annotation_items.correction: pilot meeting of my English-speaking club.
annotation_items.explanation: The singular form 'club' is needed here, and 'English-speaking' should be hyphenated.

annotation_items.text: It was six people
annotation_items.explanation: 'There were' is the correct form to indicate the presence of multiple people.

annotation_items.text: seniors to design head.
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase is reordered to reflect the hierarchy properly and 'design head' is corrected to 'head of design'.

annotation_items.text: that's the reason why it was not too fast as I wanted
annotation_items.correction: that's the reason why it was not as fast as I wanted
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'not too fast as I wanted' should be 'not as fast as I wanted' for correct comparison.

annotation_items.text: Was hard a bit
annotation_items.explanation: Correct word order and inclusion of subject needed.

annotation_items.text: ask questions for their replies.
annotation_items.correction: ask questions based on their replies.
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'for their replies' should be 'based on their replies' for clarity.

annotation_items.text: I get some feedback
annotation_items.explanation: Past tense 'got' is needed for consistency.

annotation_items.text: give it the full.
annotation_items.explanation: Grammatical error in the use of articles.

annotation_items.text: So I think it will be better to think shorter for minutes
annotation_items.correction: So I think it will be better to aim for a shorter duration like 40 minutes
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase lacks clarity and correct structure.

annotation_items.text: I think for 40 minutes it will be bad.
annotation_items.correction: I think 40 minutes would be better.
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase should provide a positive statement and correct structure.

annotation_items.text: I hear nothing from your last paragraph from beginning.
annotation_items.correction: I heard nothing from the beginning of your last paragraph.
annotation_items.explanation: The past tense 'heard' should be used to indicate a completed action in the past.

annotation_items.text: I mean I. I didn't Hear any part of your answer for my question.
annotation_items.correction: I mean, I didn't hear any part of your answer to my question.
annotation_items.explanation: The verb 'hear' should not be capitalized, and 'to' is the correct preposition for indicating purpose.

annotation_items.text: speak straightforward to
annotation_items.explanation: The correct phrase is 'speak directly into,' which is the appropriate collocation.

annotation_items.text: do not take like this one
annotation_items.correction: do not angle it like that
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase is unclear; 'angle' indicates adjustment of position.

annotation_items.text: just try to find some words
annotation_items.correction: am just trying to find some words
annotation_items.explanation: The present continuous tense should be used for ongoing actions.

annotation_items.text: decrease minutes for the meeting
annotation_items.correction: decrease the minutes of the meeting
annotation_items.explanation: Usage of 'the' and preposition 'of' is needed for clarity.

annotation_items.text: to invite four
annotation_items.explanation: Repetition is unnecessary and redundant.

annotation_items.text: because of me
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'because of me' is awkward and unclear; needs rephrasing for clarity.

annotation_items.text: do you have any strategy on this project
annotation_items.correction: do you have any strategy for this project
annotation_items.explanation: 'For' is the correct preposition for strategy regarding a project.

annotation_items.text: it's enough people. It's enough people on the market for the growing up to grow up.
annotation_items.explanation: Repetition and incorrect phrase 'growing up to grow up' needs simplification.

annotation_items.text: as individual service for some participants of club
annotation_items.correction: as an individual service for some participants of the club
annotation_items.explanation: Missing article 'an' and 'the' before nouns.

annotation_items.text: Let me speak
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'Let me speak from my heart' needs a preposition 'from'.

annotation_items.text: during six
annotation_items.explanation: The preposition 'over' is more appropriate in this context for duration.

annotation_items.text: from for
annotation_items.explanation: The preposition 'from' is unnecessary and should be removed.

annotation_items.text: with the
annotation_items.explanation: Change the article 'the' to 'a' for indefinite reference.

annotation_items.text: others potential
annotation_items.explanation: 'Other' should be used because 'potential segments' is singular in context.

annotation_items.text: the future this for
annotation_items.explanation: Correct order and prepositions needed for clarity.

annotation_items.text: Does it mean 50 people who are paying your monthly
annotation_items.correction: Does it mean 50 people who are paying you monthly
annotation_items.explanation: 'Your' is a possessive adjective and should be 'you', the object pronoun.

annotation_items.text: the main idea subscription
annotation_items.explanation: Verb 'is' is missing and needed for correct sentence structure.

annotation_items.text: 50 people with lifetime value more than
annotation_items.correction: 50 people with a lifetime value of more than
annotation_items.explanation: Missing article and correct preposition 'of'.

annotation_items.text: I don't have brother at all
annotation_items.correction: I don't have a brother at all
annotation_items.explanation: Missing article 'a' before the singular noun.

annotation_items.text: like we have with you
annotation_items.explanation: This phrase is awkward and does not clearly convey the intended meaning.

annotation_items.text: something like else
annotation_items.explanation: The correct phrase is 'something else.'

annotation_items.text: Kate backward on you
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase should be clearer, possibly intending 'Kate is back there with you.'

annotation_items.text: no one under of pillow
annotation_items.explanation: The correct phrase is 'under the pillow.'

annotation_items.text: I just want to start acquire
annotation_items.correction: I just want to start acquiring
annotation_items.explanation: 'Acquire' should be in the gerund form 'acquiring' after 'start.'

annotation_items.text: did expect. And is it enough
annotation_items.explanation: The verb 'did' is unnecessary here.

annotation_items.text: granola just to summarize the the whole meeting
annotation_items.correction: notes just to summarize the whole meeting
annotation_items.explanation: 'Granola' seems to be a mistake; 'notes' makes more sense in context, and 'the' is repeated.

annotation_items.text: join to you because
annotation_items.explanation: 'Join' does not require the preposition 'to.'

annotation_items.text: the hardness level
annotation_items.explanation: 'Hardness level' is not a standard English expression.

annotation_items.text: Level of hard.
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'level of hard' is incorrect. 'Level of difficulty' is more appropriate.

annotation_items.text: just hard topic
annotation_items.explanation: A determiner 'a' is needed before 'hard topic.'

annotation_items.text: more harder for
annotation_items.explanation: 'More harder' is redundant. 'Harder' is sufficient.

annotation_items.text: It were
annotation_items.explanation: 'It were' is incorrect. 'There were' is the correct form.

annotation_items.text: It was not lesson
annotation_items.explanation: A determiner 'a' is needed before 'lesson.'

annotation_items.text: in last year in Krasnodar
annotation_items.explanation: 'In last year' should be 'last year.'

annotation_items.text: regarding AI. What do you think about timing that we need
annotation_items.correction: What do you think about the timing when
annotation_items.explanation: The article 'the' is needed before 'timing,' and 'when' is the correct conjunction for specifying time.

annotation_items.text: currently you even don't see difference between
annotation_items.correction: currently you don't even see a difference
annotation_items.explanation: Correct order is 'don't even see' and an article 'a' is needed before 'difference.'

annotation_items.text: how you evaluate the timing when such kind
annotation_items.correction: how you evaluate the timing of when such kinds
annotation_items.explanation: 'Kinds' should be plural and 'of' is necessary before 'when.'

annotation_items.text: they can join to your meeting
annotation_items.explanation: 'Join' does not require the preposition 'to.'

annotation_items.text: I think maybe two years or less maybe.
annotation_items.correction: I think maybe two years or less.
annotation_items.explanation: Repetition of 'maybe' is unnecessary.

annotation_items.text: it will be to generic
annotation_items.explanation: 'Too' is the correct word instead of 'to' for indicating excess.

annotation_items.text: so I'm not sure that I catch the main thought from
annotation_items.correction: I'm not sure that I caught the main thought
annotation_items.explanation: The past tense 'caught' is needed for consistency with 'I'm not sure.'

annotation_items.text: So as I understand I think
annotation_items.correction: So as far as I understand, I think
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'as far as I understand' is correct usage.

annotation_items.text: the topic will be generic
annotation_items.correction: the topic will be a generic one
annotation_items.explanation: Requires an article and clarification for countable noun 'topic.'

annotation_items.text: AI can't provide you humans experience
annotation_items.correction: AI can't provide you with human experience
annotation_items.explanation: Incorrect use of 'humans' should be 'human,' and 'provide you with' is the correct collocation.

annotation_items.text: But where I'm an expert in for instance in some details
annotation_items.correction: But where I'm an expert, for instance, in some details
annotation_items.explanation: Misplaced preposition 'in' results in redundant phrase; needs clarification.

annotation_items.text: if you're talking with the other designer you can discuss same cases
annotation_items.correction: if you're talking with another designer you can discuss the same cases
annotation_items.explanation: Uses 'another' instead of 'the other,' and includes article 'the' before 'same cases.'

annotation_items.text: Some short maybe
annotation_items.explanation: 'Some short maybe' is not grammatically correct; 'might be' is needed to convey possibility, correcting the verb issue.

annotation_items.text: is it
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase should confirm with a tag question format for agreement.

annotation_items.text: It's a talk
annotation_items.explanation: The correct verb form in context is 'talked,' meaning it has been discussed.

annotation_items.text: if your decrease in expenditure on marketing
annotation_items.correction: if you decrease expenditure on marketing
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase requires a subject-verb agreement correction by removing 'your'.

annotation_items.text: if you decrease expenditure marketing
annotation_items.explanation: The word order needs correction for proper context, 'marketing expenditure' is standard usage.

annotation_items.text: retention will be shorter
annotation_items.explanation: 'Might be' conveys possibility, whereas 'will be' is definitive; context suggests the former.

annotation_items.text: a red line, strict red line.
annotation_items.explanation: Repetition is redundant; should be concise as 'a strict red line.'

annotation_items.text: pros and cons of this decision
annotation_items.correction: pros and cons to this decision
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'pros and cons to' is the correct preposition use.

annotation_items.text: if I correctly understand your question
annotation_items.correction: if I understand your question correctly
annotation_items.explanation: Incorrect adverb placement.

annotation_items.text: compare it with with
annotation_items.explanation: Repetition of the preposition "with."

annotation_items.text: I think grammar when you use
annotation_items.correction: I think of grammar when you use
annotation_items.explanation: The preposition 'of' is needed to connect 'think' with 'grammar'.

annotation_items.text: For example, he has or he have.
annotation_items.correction: For example, he has or he had.
annotation_items.explanation: 'Has' and 'have' are not parallel because they belong to different forms; it should be 'has' and 'had' to show a contrast in different tenses.

annotation_items.text: So me too. And I would add some
annotation_items.correction: So do I. And I would add some
annotation_items.explanation: 'So me too' is incorrect. The correct form is 'So do I'.

annotation_items.text: sentences. Also I feel that
annotation_items.correction: it and it would be quite easy to.
annotation_items.explanation: The subject 'it' is missing before 'would'.

annotation_items.text: the mistakes like this annoying, annoying.
annotation_items.explanation: 'Mistakes like this' should be plural 'these', and the phrase should be completed with a verb.

annotation_items.text:
thing for me for.

Speaker B: Instance, maybe same Apple.
annotation_items.correction:
thing for me.

For instance, maybe the same apple.
annotation_items.explanation: 'Instance, maybe same Apple' should be 'For instance, maybe the same apple.' for correct usage and article inclusion.

annotation_items.text: I have two one for simplifying
annotation_items.explanation: The phrase 'two one' is incorrect when the intended meaning was likely to indicate having one item, task, or subject. 'Two' and 'one' cannot be combined in this way.
